users.name: Penny Waller
users.description: Smalltime property developer/landlord.

tweets.text:
Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M

The @EnvAgency says it's spent ¬£15m over the last five years, maintaining the county's flood defences.

Five years ago this weekend, 5,000 properties were flooded during Storm Desmond, and nearly 800 bridges and more than 180 miles of road were damaged or destroyed. https://t.co/tTvlx5B5CE

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

urls.title: Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened
urls.description: Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô

tweets.text:
Police move in after Herefordshire river bulldozed and straightened https://t.co/zLdRlYgqQ0
Witness describes damage to mile-long stretch of Lugg as egregious act of ‚Äòecological vandalism‚Äô @SalmonTroutCons @NaturalEngland  @ForestryComm @EnvAgency https://t.co/hsQfSxvBTg

urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
How has this has been allowed to happen Surely the land owner must have applied for planning permission to do this to a SSSI river by the @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland ?? 
If you did WHY DID YOU? if Not if your not already investing and prosecuting WHY NOT? 
https://t.co/fHuLfGzdSz

@AnabaticW @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil There were much better responses than this. I guess the landowner just thought they had no responsibilities. They do - including towards the habitats they are privileged to have on their land. Or are you saying they did it to prevent downstream flooding? Really?

The first beaver dam in over 400 years appeared on Exmoor after beavers were released into the wild in January.

These rodents can play an important role in engineering the landscape and helping to restore streams and reduce #flooding.

Learn more: https://t.co/h7VascPfWg

urls.title: ¬£3.9 million to drive innovative tree planting
urls.description: In celebration of National Tree Week, government commits new funding to help reach its tree planting commitment

tweets.text:
Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Please reply with the hashtag #BBCWildlifexEcover & retweet to help us win ¬£150,000 from @Ecoveruk's #FertiliseTheFuture fund! Our @SalmonStour project will improve the River Stour for people & wildlife such as kingfisher & otter! Read more: https://t.co/gSHnuItC1k
#LetsLiveClean https://t.co/93QVzRVRvt

@BeccleJ @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency Quite possibly they were only midway through to the work to raise the bank on that side, widening the channel too? This vid shows the exact same spot during the Lugg flooding in Feb this year and the river channel is much narrower. Shocking destruction.

https://t.co/97QehMdJvh
@Nelliefarmhouse @denny_robert @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Nicely showing how the "custodians of the countryside" claim doesn't stand up to the merest scrutiny.

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@supercell_1996 @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency But entirely pointless as they haven‚Äôt actually raised the level of the bank. The water will be restricted by the bridge and then spill out over the field. No vegetation probably make it flood quicker now too.

tweets.text: @iojikLeigh @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Well I disagree, fines and costs are all tax deductible and can be easily swallowed by big corporations and landowners, they know they can get away with doing this stuff fairly painlessly & they factor it in to business costs. We see it again and again and again.
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Can you confirm exactly when the @EnvAgency were informed about this incident?
@NaomiLWood @MrsSusieF @Nelliefarmhouse @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency It‚Äôs out there now according to the local news, that you spotted, well done.

@denny_robert @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @denny_robert Why is everyone getting so het up about this - it done a good job imo....  Wildlife is resilient & will soon recover.. The Lugg floods when when it is mizzling, it needs cleaning out..   I know you won't agree Rob...

It's a claim that Kingsland Parish Council are prepared to backup. In a statement issued yesterday they say "The parish council supports work to improve the Lugg that is undertaken at the direction and instigation of the Environment Agency".

https://t.co/E5q4cmEzCk

@ronan_wifi @EnvAgency @Ofwat Hi Ronan, I can see we were out early this morning, but due to the location of the work we need a permit before we can start the repair, so have requested and urgent permit so the work should be beginning soon. Amy
@MilesKing10 I can‚Äôt see anything in Kingsland Parish Council minutes begging him to save the village. They seem to have been consulting the EA rather than the Farmer. https://t.co/Vhw7UfXNMT
@denny_robert @MrsSusieF @Nelliefarmhouse @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Of course.  Local ain‚Äôt ya?

Seven years ago over 800 properties in Boston were flooded by a tidal surge.
Fast forward to today the barrier project is now 65% complete with a barrier that can be used in a tidal surge event !
#PrepareActSurvive #BostonBarrier @EnvAgency https://t.co/iiOWzsVhVM

tweets.text: @TheMichaelMoran @RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency The River Lugg reached its highest level on record on 16th Feb this year, with video footage of much of the adjacent land through the area in question under flood water. This work must be an expensive, damaging and illegal attempt at preventing future flooding of their land!

@TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Herefordshire -  hope @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA and @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP can ensure something is done

Please ensure this doesn't happen again. Currently we have a nationwide crisis #NatureEmergency
@EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @NFUtweets @CAupdates https://t.co/WqKRTgY4nl
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Great work. This is diabolical
